title: Supply Chain Associate (Amazon)
description:
Zoyava (www.zoyava.co) is positioned to establish itself as a leading digital-native brand, rapidly growing its market presence. Our dedication to delivering top-notch, user-friendly supplements exclusively on Amazon underscores our commitment to unparalleled quality and an exceptional customer experience across all operations. We firmly believe that each employee's contribution is absolutely indispensable to driving our company's advancement and success.



Who we’re looking for:



We’re currently looking for a Supply Chain Associate to join our team. This role is crucial for ensuring the efficient and effective management of our supply chain operations, particularly focusing on our Amazon FBA logistics, procurement processes, and inventory management. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating shipments and labels for Amazon FBA, alongside extensive experience in procurement, including supplier communications, negotiations, and purchase order placement. If you are organized, possess strong communication skills, and are capable of maintaining a well-structured digital filing system, we would love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities & Duties:



- Handle all elements of Amazon FBA logistics, such as creating shipments, generating labels, and ensuring compliance with Amazon's policies and procedures.

- Conduct procurement activities, including supplier sourcing, negotiation, and purchase order placement. Ensure cost-effective procurement while maintaining quality standards.

- Establish efficient communication channels with suppliers to monitor order progress, address any issues, and oversee supplier partnerships.

- Effectively monitor and control inventory levels to meet demand and avoid unnecessary overstocking. Employ inventory management software to accurately track stock movements and accurately predict future requirements.

- Maintain the company's digital filing system with meticulous organization, ensuring all supplier-related documents and paperwork are accurately filed and easily accessible.



Requirements, Skills & Qualification:



- 3-5 years of FBA shipment experience

- Logistics experience creating and coordinating shipments

- Warehouse/3PL order submission and reconciliation experience

- Must have hands-on experience creating shipments and labels for Amazon FBA. The candidate should be familiar with Amazon Seller Central and have a solid understanding of FBA requirements and procedures.

- Procurement and Supplier Management: Demonstrated experience in procurement, including direct communication with suppliers, negotiation skills, and effective placement of purchase orders. The ability to build and maintain positive relationships with suppliers is essential.

- Strong proficiency in using cloud storage services (e.g., Google Drive) for document management.

- Effective verbal and written communication skills crucial for dealing with suppliers, internal teams, and managing documentation.

- Ability to manage and track inventory levels, ensuring stock availability and minimizing overstock situations. Experience with inventory software and forecasting tools is preferred.

- Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously are key.

- Available to work in EST 



What We Offer:



- A dynamic and supportive work environment in a fast-growing company. We are dedicated to partnering with career-driven individuals in search of stable, fulfilling employment opportunities.

- We offer an attractive salary and comprehensive benefits package to ensure that our employees are well-compensated and rewarded for their hard work.

- Unlimited Paid Time Off

- HMO (Medicard) 

- Opportunities for advancing your professional growth and development.



This is a remote position which requires you to have an active and fast internet connection and a personal computer or a laptop. If you meet the above criteria, please apply thru this link:




/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSer_dBdXnMcVnx-9GmQdaJOfeKnQT5LMQTyuOOnZnMHYf8wxQ/viewform

title: Vintage Buying Agent
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a vintage clothing brand sourcing unique pieces for resale to an international market. We are looking for a passionate, street-smart Buying Agent based in the Philippines — someone who lives and breathes thrift culture and knows how to spot a gem in a pile. If you love the hunt, this job is for you.



HOW YOU WILL SPEND YOUR TIME

90% — On-Ground Sourcing



5 days a week visiting ukay-ukay stores, tiangge markets, bazaars, and community sales



Identifying and purchasing vintage clothing that aligns with our brand aesthetic



Evaluating condition, fabric, print quality, and resale value of each piece



Building relationships with stall owners and vendors to get first access to new stock



Staying ahead of trends in the vintage market — what's moving, what's not



10% — Communication & Logistics

Sending regular photo updates and haul reports via messaging apps



Coordinating shipping of purchased inventory to our designated drop-off or shipping point



Tracking spend against a weekly buying budget and submitting simple expense reports



Flagging any standout grail pieces for approval before purchase



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Genuine love for vintage, thrift, and secondhand clothing culture



Strong eye for quality — able to assess fabric, condition, and print value quickly



Familiarity with ukay-ukay circuits, tiangge locations, and local market schedules



Self-motivated and comfortable working independently in the field



Reliable smartphone for photos and messaging via WhatsApp



Honest, trustworthy, and accountable with a buying budget



Basic English communication for photo captions and check-ins



COMPENSATION & LOGISTICS

Competitive monthly salary — commensurate with experience



Buying budget provided weekly — no out-of-pocket expenses required



Transportation and shipping costs reimbursed



5 days per week, flexible daily schedule based on market hours



Room to grow as the brand scales — we reward great pickers

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
Open to applicants based in Indonesia, India, Thailand and other Southeast Asian countries. Fully remote. Must work Australian hours.





SEO Specialist (Remote – Asia: Indonesia, India, Thailand WorldWide)



Full-Time | Australian Agency | Long-Term Role | Performance-Focused



Salary: Competitive – Based on Experience (AUD)



PixelStorm is a conversion-focused Australian digital agency. We help businesses grow through measurable organic traffic, leads, and revenue — not vanity metrics.



We’re looking for an experienced SEO Specialist who can take ownership of campaigns, think critically, and contribute to real performance outcomes. This is a long-term remote position working Australian business hours (AEST).



What You’ll Be Responsible For



You will work closely with our SEO Manager and Australian Account Managers to execute and improve SEO strategies across multiple client accounts.



Your core responsibilities include:



Managing and optimising Google Business Profiles (GMB)

Conducting technical SEO audits and implementing high-impact fixes

Building strategic content briefs based on search intent and keyword research

Completing keyword research for new and existing clients

Onboarding new SEO clients and setting up GA4, Search Console and tracking

Optimising on-page elements and internal linking structures

Preparing and presenting monthly performance reports (rankings, traffic, conversions)

Monitoring performance data and identifying improvement opportunities



This role suits someone who:



Has 3+ years of hands-on SEO experience

Has worked in an agency environment

Understands technical, on-page and content SEO

Is confident using GA4, Search Console and professional SEO tools

Thinks analytically and challenges assumptions using data

Communicates clearly and professionally in English





We are not looking for someone who only follows templates. We want someone who understands why actions drive results.



Non-Negotiables



Fluent, professional English (client-facing role)

Available 9am–5pm AEST

Minimum 3 years hands-on SEO experience

Reliable high-speed internet and professional remote setup

Full-time commitment (not freelance or part-time)





What We Offer



Stable, long-term role (not freelance)

Salary review after 6 months

Clear pathway to Senior SEO / SEO Lead

Supportive, data-driven team environment

Opportunity to work directly with Australian businesses



We are a small, dedicated team that values transparency, ethical SEO, and measurable performance.



About PixelStorm Based in Richmond, Australia, PixelStorm is an award-recognised digital marketing agency focused on conversion-driven strategy. We are data-first, performance-focused, and committed to long-term client growth.



How to Apply



Please submit your resume and a short cover letter with an n example of results you've achieved and what you feel are the 3 most important aspects of SEO right now.



Applications without thoughtful responses will not be considered. PixelStorm is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

title: B2B Sales Development Representative and Business Development Representative
description:
We are hiring 1 SDR and 1 BDR ASAP!!!



If you're looking for easy, low-pressure work where you send a few
s and collect a paycheck—close this tab now.

But if you're a hunter—someone who thrives on the phone, gets energy from real conversations, handles rejection like a pro, and wants to actually earn based on results—keep reading.



About Us: 

We provide software solutions to car dealerships across the United States. 



100+ active dealership clients – this isn't a startup guessing at product-market fit

13+ years of founder experience running buy centers

500+ product demos conducted by the founder personally



You'll be calling US car dealers—Used Car Managers, Acquisition Managers, General Managers—the people who d
 what tools their dealership buys. These are busy, direct, no-BS businesspeople. If you can earn their attention, you can earn real money here.



Key Responsibilities:



We're hiring for two distinct roles. Read both descriptions carefully and apply for the one that fits your skills and experience. If you're not sure, apply for SDR—top performers get promoted to BDR.

SDR – Sales Development Representative

"The Hunter" | High-Volume Outbound Calling

Your Mission: Fill the top of the funnel. Make 60–80+ calls per day. Find decision-makers. Qualify leads. Pass them to BDRs.

You're great at: Cold calling, handling rejection, getting past gatekeepers, researching contacts, high-volume work.

You're NOT doing: Demos, proposals, closing. You hand off qualified leads to BDRs.

Best for: People who love the grind, have thick skin, and want to prove themselves.

BDR – Business Development Representative

"The Closer's Partner" | Pipeline & Relationship Management

Your Mission: Convert qualified leads into booked demos. Follow up relentlessly. Help get contracts signed.

You're great at: Building relationships, managing pipelines, persistent follow-up, professional communication.

You're NOT doing: Product demos or price negotiations. The founder does all demos and closing. You book meetings, prep materials, chase paperwork.

Best for: People with sales experience who want to work fewer accounts at higher stakes.



Requirements/Qualifications:



Compensation Structure:



You get a guaranteed base every month—no clawbacks. Commission is uncapped. The harder you work, the more you earn. 



SDR (Sales Development Representative)

Guaranteed Base Salary: $1,200 -$1,500/month

Target OTE (On-Target Earnings): $1,800 – $2,200/month

Top Performer OTE: $2,400+/month

Growth Path: Promoted to BDR



BDR (Business Development Representative)

Guaranteed Draw: $1,500 - $2,000/month

Target OTE (On-Target Earnings): $3,000 – $4,000/month

Top Performer OTE: $4,000+/month

Growth Path: Senior BDR / Team Lead



How to Apply:

Take an online assessment through this link- 



The assessment includes written questions and audio responses. Please ensure you answer all questions and upload your CV as an attachment.



Important: The audio assessment is a required first step in our hiring process. It allows us to evaluate your English fluency and communication skills. Only candidates who meet all qualifications will move forward to the next stage.

title: Field Operations Manager (AU/NZ Market Research)
description:
Job Title: Field Operations Manager (AU/NZ Market Research)



Are you a high-level operations expert who thrives on managing complex logistics and leading remote teams?

TKW Research Group is seeking a results-driven Field Operations Manager to act as the "command Centre" for our national face-to-face data collection operations across Australia and New Zealand. Reporting directly to our CEO and General Manager, you will lead the end-to-end management of large-scale field projects—from recruitment and training to real-time troubleshooting.



This is not a typical Virtual Assistant role; it is an "all-rounder" leadership position designed for a professional who excels at people management and operational oversight in a fast-paced environment.

The Role: What You’ll Be Doing



Workforce Leadership: Manage a geographically dispersed team of field interviewers across various metropolitan areas in Australia and New Zealand.



Operational Oversight: Direct all in-person data collection, including project logistics, complex scheduling, and resource allocation to meet strict client deadlines.



Real-Time Problem Solving: Act as the primary technical and operational support for staff in the field, resolving issues with tablet devices and survey software on the fly.



Quality & Performance: Monitor performance in real-time to ensure benchmarks are met and data validity follows ISO 20252:2019 standards.



Strategic Growth: Collaborate with the executive team to identify new business opportunities and scale the division into new territories.



Who You Are



Exceptional Communicator: You possess "top shelf" written and spoken English, capable of coordinating with high-level stakeholders and international teams.



Proven Leader: You have significant experience managing remote or geographically dispersed workforces.



Logistics Expert: You have a "problem-solving mindset" and can handle shifting priorities, complex rosters, and unpredictable field variables like a pro.



Tech-Savvy: You are highly proficient with mobile devices (Android/iOS) and project management tools.



Position Details & Benefits



Location: Fully Remote (Philippines-based).



Hours: Flexibility is required to match Australian/NZ time zones (e.g., early starts); the role operates 7 days a week during active field periods.



Compensation: Up to USD 12.50 per hour, depending on skill level and demonstrated experience (reviewed after 6 months).



Support & Scaling: You will receive direct training from the CEO and GM. Once you are proficient and autonomous, we will employ a Virtual Assistant to support you, allowing you to focus on strategic division growth.



How to Apply (Phase 1)



To ensure you have a high attention to detail, please follow these instructions carefully: 



1. Send your resume and a brief cover letter 

2. Use the Subject Line: Field Manager - Melbourne

3. Include a brief paragraph (max 100 words) explaining your experience managing remote teams.



Note: Applications that do not follow the subject line instruction will not be considered.

title: Dance Instructor Recruiter & Scheduler
description:
Gig Recruiter – Dance Instructor Talent & Scheduler (Remote)



Job Type: Independent Contractor / Part Time

Schedule: Flexible | As-Needed Throughout the Year



About the Role-

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Dance Instructor Recruiter & Scheduler to help us identify and attract top-tier dance, fitness and yoga instructors. This person would also be responsible for efficiently and effectively handling subbing and staffing for instructors calling out and needing coverage for their class. This would require daily hands-on communication and being extremely proactive. communicative and present. 



Your primary responsibilities will be sourcing and recruiting qualified, high-quality dance, yoga and fitness instructors using platforms such as Indeed, Google search,
 groups, forums, online communities, location-based studio searches and other creative sourcing strategies. You will also maintain and continuously update a structured database of vetted dance talent. In addition, a daily task of scheduling, sourcing and communicating with our internal team of instructors to find and secure substitute instructors for approximately 50-100 classes per month. 



This role requires exceptional written and spoken English skills. You must be able to communicate clearly, confidently, and naturally with native English-speaking instructors.



Key Responsibilities-

Source qualified dance/yoga/fitness instructors through:

Our company’s Indeed account

Targeted Google searches

 groups and communities

Online forums and dance networks

Creative and strategic outreach methods

Identify and engage high-quality dance professionals across multiple styles

Seek, secure and communicate with subs to fill in empty classes



Pre-screen candidates to assess:

Dance training and experience

Teaching experience

Professionalism and communication skills

Overall qualifications and fit

Availability



Ask informed, relevant questions to evaluate instructor competency

Clearly and persuasively communicate what this opportunity entails and the value of working with our organization

Build trust and generate genuine interest from instructors through strong, personable communication

Maintain a well-organized, constantly updated database of qualified instructors

Track outreach efforts and recruitment progress

Required Qualifications

Exceptional written and spoken English (near-native fluency required)

Extremely professional and highly reliable

Warm, personable, and engaging communication style — never robotic or scripted

Ability to instill trust and build rapport quickly with professional instructors

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Experience in recruiting, sourcing, or talent acquisition (preferred)

Background or experience in dance and/or dance instruction

Clear understanding of what qualifies a strong, skilled dance instructor

Comfortable using online platforms and social media for recruitment

Self-motivated and able to work independently



Ideal Candidate- You are:

Resourceful and creative in finding talent

Able to recognize high-level dance experience and teaching ability

Confident explaining opportunities in a compelling, professional way

Skilled at building authentic connections through communication

Structured, detail-oriented, and dependable

Able to work effectively, daily and organized to always be working ahead



Compensation

Paid hourly 



Flexible hours

Long-term opportunity for ongoing gig work throughout the year provided the role proves affective in key benchmark assessments



If you are passionate about dance, understand what makes a great instructor, and excel at building trust through professional, personable communication, we would love to hear from you. You must be an extremely organized, proactive and communicative individual who knows about scheduling and has some form of background in dance or fitness. 



To apply, please submit:

Your resume

A brief description of your experience with dance and/or recruiting, scheduling, business

Examples of how you have sourced talent online

Example of how you've done any type of similar job, task or industry work in the past

title: Senior Tax Accountant
description:
Role: Senior Tax Accountant

Contract: Full-time Remote Contractor 

(40 hours weekly / 160 hours monthly)

Business Hours: Monday through Friday, 8 AM – 4 PM MST (service hours flexible during this time)

Rate: $3,000 - $3,500 USD monthly / $36,000 - $42,000 USD annually (salary is negotiable based on experience and location)

Availability to Start: Immediately





What You'll Do



As a Senior Tax Accountant, your role is essential in ensuring compliance with U.S. tax regulations and supporting clients with strategic tax planning and accurate filings. Success in this position means managing complex tax matters, maintaining current knowledge of tax laws, and delivering reliable, high-quality service to clients. Your responsibilities will include:



-Handle complex tax compliance and planning for businesses and individuals, including federal, state, and local tax filings.

-Prepare and review tax provisions while ensuring adherence to U.S. tax regulations.

-Accurately prepare and file business tax returns such as Forms 1120S, 1120, 1065, and 1040.

-Provide expert guidance on tax strategies that align with clients' financial goals and ensure regulatory compliance.

-Review tax returns for accuracy, completeness, and proper documentation before submission.

-Conduct detailed reconciliations and maintain accurate and organized tax records.

-Collaborate with accounting teams on financial reporting, bookkeeping, intercompany transactions, and payroll-related tax matters.

-Support audit readiness by maintaining organized documentation and ensuring timely reporting.

-Stay informed on changes to federal, state, and local tax regulations and apply them to maintain ongoing compliance.



What You Should Have



Must-haves:

-Minimum of five years of experience with US-based Accounting firms, focusing on Tax Accounting.

-Certified Public Accountant with a background in Accountancy.

-At least one year of experience in a global remote setup with a company based in North America, Europe, Australia, or the UAE.

-Proficiency in QuickBooks Online; CCH Axcess Tax and TaxDome are a plus.

-Skilled in preparing various tax returns: partnerships, S-corps, C-corps, individuals, and trusts.

-Strong knowledge of US tax laws, compliance standards and multi-state filings.

-Proven experience handling Forms 1120S, 1120, 1065, and 1040.

-Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and Microsoft 365.

-Excellent English verbal and written communication abilities across all levels of an organization.

-Demonstrated leadership with a results-driven mindset.

-Detail-oriented with expertise in complex reconciliations and tax documentation.

-Self-motivated with strong time management skills in a remote environment.



Technology Specifications: 

-Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

-Windows 11 or MacOS 15 Sequoia 

-Minimum Intel i5 8th gen with 8GB RAM or Apple M1 chip with 8GB RAM

-Webcam and Headset

-Designated Office Space in your home



Nice-to-haves:

-Ability to train or mentor junior accountants or preparers.

-Exposure to advisory services such as tax planning, entity structuring, or IRS representation.

-Background in managing high-net-worth individual tax returns or trust returns.



Who You Are



We are hoping you are someone who:

-Communicates clearly and confidently with clients and team members, ensuring smooth collaboration.

-Applies critical thinking and problem-solving skills to complex tax scenarios.

-Organizes tasks effectively, managing multiple clients and deadlines with precision.

-Maintains high accuracy and attention to detail in tax preparation and review.

-Exercises sound professional judgment and handles sensitive financial information with discretion.

title: Video Editor – Paid Media (DTC / Meta Ads)
description:
About Us

We are a DTC stationery brand built around premium stone paper products — think notebooks, planners, and sketchbooks that are waterproof, tear-resistant, and genuinely beautiful. We run high-performing paid social campaigns across Meta and are scaling fast. You’ll be working directly with our marketing lead to produce ad creative that converts.



The Role

We’re looking for a video editor with a strong grasp of storytelling and consumer psychology. You’ll be editing UGC, scripted ads, and brand content for Meta — and we expect every creative decision to be intentional and conversion-focused, not just aesthetic.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Editing UGC and scripted video content specifically for Meta 
 & Instagram) ads

• Building hooks, narrative arcs, and emotional payoffs that drive conversion

• Using pacing, music, and visual rhythm to guide the viewer’s attention and emotional state

• Adding subtitles, captions, b-roll, transitions, and motion text — all in service of the story

• Iterating quickly on feedback — we test a lot and move fast

• Occasionally supporting organic social and LinkedIn content



What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience editing DTC Meta video ads — this is non-negotiable

• A solid understanding of storytelling and consumer psychology — you know what makes people stop, engage, and buy

• A portfolio of performance-focused ad creative where you can speak to the intent behind each edit

• Strong attention to detail — clean cuts, correct aspect ratios, no audio issues

• Fast execution with the ability to take direction and run with it

• Comfortable working async with a remote team across time zones

• Familiarity with CapCut, Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

• Bonus: experience with Figma, After Effects, or motion graphics



Why Work With Us

• Direct access to the marketing decision-maker — no layers of approvals

• Creative freedom within a clear brief

• Consistent, ongoing work with room to grow as we scale



To Apply

Send us your portfolio or showreel with examples of Meta ad edits you’ve worked on.

description:

title: Shopify Content & Launch Coordinator
description:
Shopify Content & Launch Coordinator



Remote, Philippines

Contract, Project Based

Up to 40 hours per week

Working hours: 9AM to 5PM EST

Rate, 4 USD per hour



About the Role



We are looking for a detail oriented and technically savvy Shopify specialist to support the final pre launch phase of an e commerce website.



The website build is already completed. This role focuses on polishing, updating, and preparing the site for launch.



This is a short term contract role for the duration of the project, estimated at one to two weeks depending on execution speed and quality. Strong performance may lead to ongoing opportunities on future projects.



What You Will Be Doing



You will be responsible for final content coordination and launch readiness, including



• Updating product images and replacing missing visuals

• Using AI tools to edit and standardize backgrounds of new images

• Adding or revising product descriptions and content

• Identifying missing content sections and filling gaps

• Coordinating with the client to collect required materials

• Reviewing user journeys to ensure logical flow and consistency

• Ensuring the site is clean, accurate, and ready for launch

• Flagging issues and proposing practical improvements



This is not just a content upload role. We need someone who can think through the experience from a product and user perspective.



What We Are Looking For



Required



• Experience working inside Shopify

• Strong written and spoken English

• Excellent attention to detail

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

• Comfortable working full time hours during the project

• Based in the Philippines



Preferred



• Product mindset with understanding of user journeys

• Basic business analysis skills

• Technical awareness of how websites function

• Comfortable using AI tools for image editing and content support

• Experience reviewing websites for usability and logic



What Success Looks Like



• The website is fully updated with accurate content

• Images are visually consistent using AI background edits

• All content gaps are filled

• The user journey makes sense and flows smoothly

• Launch readiness checklist is completed



Why Join



• Opportunity to work directly with a digital product team

• Exposure to product thinking and launch processes

• Potential for long term collaboration if performance is strong



If you are organized, technically curious, and enjoy polishing digital products before launch, we would love to hear from you.



Please share

• Your Shopify experience

• Tools you have used, including AI tools

• Your availability for full time project work

• Examples of Shopify sites you have worked on

5. Residential Clients

o Landlords/property managers of rental units

o Real estate agents (who prepare homes for sale)

o Airbnb/short-term rental owners



Skills and Qualifications:

• Must have experience reading and interpreting blueprints in the US

• Must have at least 3 years of experience doing takeoffs 

• Must have worked for US construction companies doing takeoffs and estimating

• Must be fairly familiar with pricing material in the US

• Must be able and willing to work during US business hours 9-6PM and weekends when required

• Work on weekends, if necessary/when required.

• Maintain clear client communication and high job-site standards.

• Read and interpret blueprints, architectural plans, and scopes of work.

• Develop and implement marketing strategies designed to increase sales and market share, sale goals levels, and brand awareness locally and regionally.

• Seek out and constantly bid for commercial and residential jobs.

• Provide expertise feedback to prospective customers.

• Provide a written report on the scope of work to the office and prepare accurate quotes for prospective customers.

• Negotiate pricing and contract terms in coordination with owner.

• Ensure all of our processes are of the highest standards and that we are in compliance with all government and clients' requirements.

• Maintain customer satisfaction by successfully managing the completion of projects on time.

• Ensure projects meet timelines, budget goals, and quality standards.

title: Loan Processing Specialist
description:
Loan Processing Specialist 

(Post-Submission to Settlement)

 

In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-Time | Long-Term Role 

 

About the Role 

In Financial Services operates a highly structured, system-led mortgage business built around file quality, clear communication, and controlled progress through every stage of the loan journey. 



We are seeking a Loan Processing Specialist to manage standard loan files from post-submission through to settlement. 

This role forms part of our Processing Team and reports directly to our Processing Manager. 



Once a file has been submitted by the Credit Team, you take ownership of its progress — managing conditions, communication, and settlement coordination. 



This is a high-accountability execution role focused on 
ntum, clarity, and delivery. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

A file moves from submission to settlement smoothly and on time. 

> Conditional approvals are tracked and managed proactively 

> Outstanding requirements are cleared efficiently 

> Clients receive clear and timely milestone updates 

> Lenders and solicitors are communicated with consistently 

> Settlement timelines are monitored and controlled 

> Complex issues are escalated promptly to the Processing Manager 



From the client’s perspective, the process feels organised and professional. 

From the broker’s perspective, the file progresses without friction. 

From the business’s perspective, milestones are met without last-minute pressure. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

1. Manage standard loan files from post-submission through to settlement 

2. Track conditional approvals and ensure all lender requirements are satisfied 

3. Communicate regularly with clients, lenders, and solicitors 

4. Provide structured milestone updates 

5. Monitor settlement dates and coordinate documentation 

6. Maintain accurate system notes and workflow updates 

7. Escalate policy concerns, structural issues, or delays to the Processing Manager 

8. Support the Processing Manager in maintaining workflow standards 

 

Skills & Experience 

>> 1–3 years’ experience in Australian mortgage processing or financial administration 

>> Clear understanding of conditional approval and settlement stages 

>> Strong organisation and follow-up discipline 

>> Professional written and verbal communication 

>> Client-service mindset 

>> Comfortable working within structured systems and defined processes 

>> Motivated to develop deeper lending knowledge over time 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A passive administrative support role 

(X) A wait-for-instructions position 

(X) A role where files are allowed to drift 

(X) We operate with clear structure and consistent 
ntum. Files move forward daily. 

 

Why Join Us 

-Long-term role within a growing Australian brokerage 

-Structured systems and clearly defined workflows 

-Direct reporting line to a dedicated Processing Manager 

-Established offshore team environment 

-Clear progression pathway within the Processing and Credit Team 

-Opportunity to grow into more technical or complex file handling over time

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Categorize transactions in QuickBooks Online

• Perform monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

• Assist with payroll processing and payroll journal entries

• Prepare support documentation for sales tax filings

• Maintain clean and organized client files

• Follow detailed SOP checklists

• Meet strict monthly close deadlines

• Communicate clearly in written English



Accuracy is more important than speed.



?



REQUIREMENTS

title: Customer Success/ Support E-Commerce
description:
About Nordmut

Nordmut is a growing e?commerce company based in Hamburg, focused on delivering high?quality products and a seamless online shopping experience to our customers. We combine data?driven decision making with a strong customer focus to build long?term relationships and sustainable growth.



Role Overview

As a Customer Success Manager at Nordmut, you are responsible for ensuring that our B2C customers achieve their desired outcomes with our products and services and enjoy a consistently excellent experience across all touchpoints. You will own the post?purchase relationship, drive adoption and retention, and act as the main link between our customers and internal teams such as Sales, Marketing, Product, and Operations.



Key Responsibilities

Own and manage a portfolio of customers, building strong, long?term relationships and acting as their primary point of contact.



Monitor customer health, usage, and feedback using our CRM and analytics tools, and proactively engage customers to prevent churn and increase satisfaction.



Conduct regular business reviews (e.g. QBRs) to discuss performance, optimization opportunities, and strategic next steps with key accounts.



Work closely with our Support team to ensure fast, high?quality resolution of operational and technical issues and communicate clearly with customers throughout.



Collect, structure, and share customer feedback with Product, Marketing, and Operations to improve our assortment, online shop experience, and services.



Contribute to scalable customer?facing assets such as help center content, playbooks, FAQs, and best?practice guides for our e?commerce offerings.



Track and report on key customer success metrics (NPS, retention, expansion, order frequency, return rate, etc.) and derive concrete action plans.



Requirements

2–4 years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, E?Commerce Management, or a similar customer?facing role, ideally in an online retail or digital environment.



Strong customer orientation, with the ability to understand business goals, translate them into concrete actions, and build trust?based relationships.



Excellent communication and presentation skills in English; German language skills are a strong plus.



Solid analytical skills, confidence working with data, and experience using CRM or CS tools and dashboards (e.g. Zendesk, Salesforce, Gainsight, or similar).



Good understanding of e?commerce processes (traffic, conversion, merchandising, fulfillment, returns) and customer lifecycle management.



Proactive, solution?oriented working style with strong ownership, prioritization, and time management skills.



Ability to work cross?functionally and coordinate with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Operations teams.



What We Offer

The opportunity to shape the customer success function at Nordmut and have a direct impact on customer satisfaction and company growth.



A dynamic e?commerce environment with short decision paths and a high degree of autonomy.



A collaborative team culture, flexible working arrangements, and modern tools to support your work.



An office in Hamburg plus the option to work remotely several days per week.



If you are passionate about building strong customer relationships in e?commerce and want to help our customers and Nordmut grow together, we look forward to your application.

title: AI VIDEO EDITOR
description:
We are looking for a high-output AI Video Editor to lead creative production for our Meta (FB/IG) ad campaigns. You are building high-converting visual assets using the latest AI generation tools. We have the SOPs and workflows ready to go—we just need the expert to pilot the ship. Worst case, if you don't have access to AI tools for less money, we can invest in tools.



Example of ads we need:


 (animations)


 (ai avatars)


 (vsl style)


 (ugc)



What You’ll Do:

AI Avatar Generation: Create lifelike, brand-consistent avatars for spokesperson-style ads (HeyGen, Synthesia, or similar).



Voiceover & Audio: Generate and sync high-fidelity AI voiceovers (ElevenLabs) with perfect emotive pacing.



Video Generation: Use tools like Runway (Gen-3/Gen-4), Luma Dream Machine, or Kling to create B-roll and visual "hooks" that stop the scroll.



Performance Editing: Edit for Meta Ads—this means focusing on the first 3 seconds (The Hook), pattern interrupts, and clear CTAs.



Iteration: Rapidly test different hooks and angles based on performance data.



Your Toolstack (You should have access and proficiency):



Video Gen: Runway, VEO, Sora.



Avatars: HeyGen.



Audio: ElevenLabs.



Editing: Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve.



Requirements:

Portfolio: Must show at least 3 examples of AI-generated ads (not just "cool clips"—they must look like ads that sell).



Technical Understanding: Deep knowledge of aspect ratios (4:5, 9:16) and Meta’s 2026 creative best practices.



Speed: Ability to turn around a first draft in few hours following our SOPs.



Character Consistency: You know how to keep an AI character looking the same across multiple shots.

title: Senior Credit Analyst
description:
Senior Credit Analyst 

(Policy & Submission Quality) 



In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-Time | Long-Term Role 

 

About the Role 

In Financial Services operates a highly structured, system-led mortgage business built around strong credit assessment, clean submissions, and a controlled client experience. 



We are seeking a Senior Credit Analyst to manage complex lending files and ensure policy strength and submission quality across the business. 



This role forms part of our structured Credit Team and reports directly to our Australian-based Credit Manager. 



You will operate within defined lending standards and quality controls, working closely with brokers before submission to ensure deals are structured correctly, serviced accurately, and positioned clearly for lender assessment. 



This is a senior technical role focused on credit judgment, policy interpretation, and submission integrity. 



We value depth of knowledge, strong credit judgment, and consistent execution. This role is for someone confident in handling complexity — not someone learning it for the first time. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

A complex file enters Credit — company structure, SMSF, trust, layered income, or multi-security. 



From there: 

> Structure is reviewed and refined where required 

> Servicing is calculated accurately and aligned to lender policy 

> Risks are identified early and mitigated 

> Supporting documentation is complete and clearly organised 

> Submission notes are strategic and well-positioned 

> Files are lodged cleanly with minimal lender queries 

> Assessors receive clear, structured applications 



From the broker’s perspective, the deal is strong and submission-ready. 

From the lender’s perspective, the file is clear, complete, and easy to assess. 

From the business’s perspective, submission quality reduces friction and improves turnaround times. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

1. Assess and structure complex loan files prior to submission 

2. Interpret lender policy and apply correct credit positioning 

3. Complete accurate servicing calculations across multiple lender platforms 

4. Prepare structured and strategic submission notes 

5. Conduct final quality control checks before lodgement 

6. Collaborate with brokers to strengthen deal structure 

7. Escalate high-level policy concerns to the Credit Manager where required 

8. Maintain strong knowledge of lender updates and policy changes 

9. Support the continuous improvement of credit standards and submission quality 

 

Skills & Experience 

>> 5+ years’ experience in Australian mortgage credit or loan assessment 

>> Strong experience across multiple lender servicing calculators 

>> Practical knowledge of: 

    • Company and trust structures 

    • SMSF lending 

    • Multi-security loans 

    • Complex income scenarios 

>> Deep understanding of lender policy interpretation 

>> Strong analytical and problem-solving ability 

>> High attention to detail with structured file preparation 

>> Calm and confident communicator 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A junior processing role 

(X) A data-entry position 

(X) A purely administrative function 

(X) This is a senior technical seat within a quality-driven Credit Team. 

 

Why Join Us 

-Long-term role within a growing Australian brokerage 

-Structured systems and clearly defined credit workflows 

-Direct reporting line to the Australian credit leadership 

-Established offshore team environment 

-Opportunity to influence credit standards and submission quality 

-Be part of a business that values precision, professionalism, and performance

title: Systems & Automation Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 

 

About the Role 

In Financial Services is building a highly systemised, automation-led mortgage business designed around an exceptional client experience. 



Our focus is on removing friction at every stage of the loan lifecycle. Systems, automation, and AI are used to quietly handle data flow, documentation, task creation, and handovers across the entire loan lifecycle - from first enquiry through to submission, approval, settlement, and long-term review - so our clients feel supported and confident, and our team can focus on advice, problem-solving, and outcomes. 



We’re looking for a Systems & Automation Lead to work closely with the leadership team and alongside our established, high-performing offshore team in the Philippines. 



This role owns how our systems operate day to day. You’ll identify opportunities, improve workflows, and help shape how automation and AI support both our clients and our internal teams as the business continues to scale. 



This is a hands-on execution role for someone who enjoys building clean systems, improving efficiency, and working as part of a connected, collaborative remote team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>A client enters the business via an enquiry, referral, or campaign. From there: 

>>Client information flows cleanly into GoHighLevel (GHL) and into Broker Engine without duplication 

>>Meetings are booked with accurate pre-filled client data 

>>Client documents are guided, collected, named, and stored correctly 

>>Submission, approval, settlement, and post-settlement steps are system-led and automated where possible 

>>Tasks, notes, and handovers are created automatically for brokers and processing teams 

>>Ongoing reviews and retention workflows trigger without manual follow-up 



From the client’s perspective, the process feels clear, organised, and easy. 

From the team’s perspective, files are structured, complete, and ready to progress at every stage. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

>>Own the build, optimisation, and ongoing improvement of workflows across Broker Engine and GoHighLevel (GHL) 

>>Design and maintain integrations between Broker Engine, GHL, document storage, compliance workflows, and other systems using automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Automate workflows across the full mortgage lifecycle, including lead intake, data capture, submission, approval, settlement, post-settlement, and ongoing review 

>>Embed AI and Copilot-style tools into workflows to support meeting summaries, task creation, file notes, quality checks, and handovers 

>>Ensure client data and documents are captured, named, and stored correctly to support a seamless client experience 

>>Create role-based task automation so brokers and processing teams work from systems, not memory 

>>Document systems and workflows clearly, including SOPs, process maps, and short training guides 

>>Maintain a backlog of system, automation, and AI improvements and support continuous optimisation 

>>Support system setup and integration for new hires and future loan book acquisitions 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong hands-on experience building and maintaining advanced workflows in GoHighLevel, including pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, calendars, and multi-step client journeys 

>>Experience working with Broker Engine or similar mortgage broker CRMs 

>>Experience working with system integrations, including API-based connections, webhooks, and automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Practical experience applying AI tools (such as Copilot) within structured, repeatable workflows 

>>Solid understanding of mortgage or financial services workflows, including submission and post-settlement stages 

>>Highly process-driven with strong attention to detail 

>>Able to build, document, and explain systems clearly 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A marketing or funnel optimisation role 

(X) A compliance interpretation role 

(X) A strategy-only role 



You’ll be executing approved solutions within clear systems and governance. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian brokerage 

2. Work alongside an established offshore team in the Philippines 

3. Dedicated systems role within the offshore team, working closely with Australian leadership 

3. Strong team culture with daily collaboration via Microsoft Teams 

4. Opportunities to work on meaningful automation and AI initiatives that improve real client outcomes 

5. Clear priorities, structured workflows, and high standards 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for excellence, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and we believe smart systems, automation, and great people working together make that possible. 

 

Next Steps 

If you enjoy building intelligent systems, embedding automation and AI into real workflows, and being part of a connected, high-performing remote team, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Content Editor & Production Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 



About the Role 

In Financial Services is a growing, award-winning mortgage brokerage building a strong digital presence through education-led video content distributed across multiple platforms, including YouTube and other digital channels. 



We’re looking for a Content Editor & Production Lead to own the full production of our video content - from raw footage through to final, publish-ready assets. 



Our content includes: 

>>Educational finance and property videos 

>>Trust-building client review and testimonial videos 

>>Short-form clips and video ad creatives 

>>Internal and client experience videos (e.g. updates, nurture campaigns) 



This is not a marketing strategy role and not a junior VA position. 



You’ll work closely with our Australian leadership and marketing team, taking approved content ideas and raw recordings and turning them into complete, production-ready content - including video edits, visuals, thumbnails, and uploads once approved. 



This role focuses on production ownership and execution excellence - supporting campaigns, ads, and client communications through high-quality content, while strategy, budgets, and performance optimisation sit with the marketing team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>Educational long-form videos are edited, packaged, and published consistently across approved platforms 

>>Client review videos are polished, authentic, and professionally presented 

>>Thumbnails are clear, on-brand, and designed to support engagement 

>>Short-form clips and video ads are efficiently produced from long-form content 

>>Content is uploaded accurately once approved, with correct titles, descriptions, and basic formatting 

>>The marketing team is freed up to focus on growth, partnerships, and client experience 

>>Our content library becomes a valuable long-term asset for the business 

 

Key Responsibilities 



Long-Form Educational & Client Video Production 

>>Edit long-form educational videos (for YouTube, podcasts and other approved platforms), interviews, and presentations 

>>Edit client review and testimonial videos to a professional, trustworthy standard 

>>Clean audio, remove dead space, tighten pacing, and structure content for clarity 

>>Apply consistent branding, chapters, lower thirds, titles, and visual standards 



Short-Form Content & Ad Creative 

>>Cut long-form education and client review content into short-form clips 

>>Produce dynamic video ad creatives using approved messaging, visuals, overlays, and supporting assets 

>>Take raw footage and create interesting and unique videos that perform well on TikTok/Instagram and META ads.  

>>Ensure all creatives align with brand tone and guidelines 



Thumbnails & Visual Assets 

>>Design thumbnails and supporting visual assets for videos and ads 

>>Maintain a consistent thumbnail style and branding 

>>Make revisions based on internal feedback (analytics ownership not required) 



Content Upload & Publishing Support 

>>Upload approved content to platforms (e.g. video platforms, ad platforms, social platfoms) 

>>Apply approved titles, descriptions, tags, chapters, and basic formatting 

>>Ensure content is published correctly and on schedule once approved 



Content Production Flow 

>>Manage the end-to-end production workflow from raw files ? published assets 

>>Maintain clear file naming, version control, and content organisation 

>>Work closely with the marketing team to meet publishing schedules 



Quality Control & Consistency 

>>Ensure all content meets quality and brand standards before publishing 

>>Maintain consistency across long-form, short-form, ads, and thumbnails 

>>Flag opportunities to improve production efficiency or quality 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong experience producing education-led long-form video content end to end for multiple platforms 

>>Experience editing client review or testimonial videos 

>>Experience creating thumbnails and simple video ad creatives 

>>Confident using professional editing tools (Premiere Pro, Capcut, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve, or similar) 

>>Comfortable creating thumbnails using tools such as Photoshop, Canva, or similar 

>>Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and clarity for educational content 

>>Excellent attention to detail and pride in clean, polished work 

>>Able to manage multiple projects without quality dropping 

>>Able to work independently on video production and confident to produce original ideas  



Highly Regarded (Not Essential): 

>>Experience creating video content that supports paid ads,
 campaigns, or client nurture journeys 

>>Experience working within content-led businesses where long-form video supports audience growth, trust, and client acquisition 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A content strategy or growth role 

(X) A paid ads management role 

(X) A performance analytics role 

(X) A junior VA position 



You’ll be responsible for production and delivery, not deciding what content to create or how campaigns perform. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian business 

2. Clear expectations and structured workflows 

3. Work alongside a collaborative offshore and Australian team 

4. Purpose-driven content focused on education and trust (not clickbait) 

5. Opportunity to grow with the business as content output scales 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for education, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and our content plays a key role in delivering that mission. 

 

Next Steps 

To apply, please include: 

>>Examples of long-form educational videos you’ve produced 

>>Examples of thumbnails and ad creatives you’ve created 

>>A brief summary of your content production experience 

>>Your expected monthly rate

title: Hire Copywriter for Advertorials & Listicles (Full-Time)
description:
?? Apply only if you've personally written and launched high-converting advertorials and listicles for DTC brands.



???? Apply here: 



About Skinnify

???? Watch our company video first:



At Skinnify (www.skinnify.co), we’re reinventing fitness by integrating resistance into everyday clothing. In just three years, we’ve grown from 0 to 150,000+ customers — and we’re scaling fast.

We’re now hiring a full-time Copywriter to own the writing and optimization of our advertorials, listicles, quiz funnels, and post-purchase upsell flows.



???? What You’ll Be Writing

This is not a generic content role.

We need someone who has personally written and launched:

High-converting advertorials

Long-form listicles

You’ll work directly with our funnel builder, media buyers, and creative team to continuously improve performance.

This role is about conversion copy, not blog writing.



???? You’re the Right Fit If…

?? You’ve written advertorials, and listicles for DTC brands (not just blogs or SEO content)

?? You understand cold traffic psychology and objection handling

?? You know how to structure a story that keeps readers scrolling

?? You write with performance in mind — CTR, CVR, AOV

?? You’re comfortable analyzing results and iterating based on data

?? You take ownership and hit deadlines without being chased

?? You can adapt tone (native-style, editorial, “real story,” scientific, etc.)

Bonus if you:

Have experience in health, fitness, beauty, or women’s products

Understand Meta ad traffic and advertorial-to-checkout flows

Have written post-purchase upsell sequences



???? Why Join Skinnify?

???? Work Fully Remote – Flexible location and schedule

???? Hyper-Growth Brand – Real scale, real traffic, real impact

???? High Ownership Role – Your copy directly affects revenue

???? Performance-Focused Team – Decisions based on data, not opinions

???? Learn & Grow Fast – Work with experienced media buyers and creatives

? Loved by the team: 5/5 rating on Glassdoor





???????? The Skinnify Story

Skinnify was founded to help busy women get fitter without going to the gym.

Our first product — resistance band leggings — turned everyday movement into exercise. Today, we’re building an entire ecosystem of innovative fitness wear.



???? Skinnify’s Core Values

???? Innovation – We rethink what fitness clothing can do

???? Effectiveness – Every product and funnel must perform

???? Accessibility – Fitness for busy, real people

???? Fun – Work should feel energizing, not draining

? Quality – High standards in everything we build

title: Wordpress SEO & Content Strategist
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, and other service businesses across the US. We are quickly growing and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's dedicated SEO Specialist -- the person responsible for making our clients findable online. You'll handle the full SEO cycle for each client: keyword research, content creation and publishing, on-page optimization, link building, citation management, and Google Business Profile management. Your work compounds over time and becomes the organic engine that drives long-term client growth alongside our paid advertising efforts.





Responsibilities:



- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and build monthly content plans for each client using our premium SEO platform (Search Atlas -- training available).



- Create SEO-optimized content using Search Atlas and our AI tools (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT), then edit every piece for human quality, accuracy, and brand voice.



- Publish content directly in WordPress using pre-built page templates.



- Apply on-page SEO in WordPress via RankMath -- meta tags, heading structure, internal linking, schema, alt text, clean URLs.



- Execute white-hat link building -- backlink outreach, editorial submissions, and guest post outreach using Search Atlas tools.



- Build and manage business citations across key directories (Google, Yelp, BBB, Bing Places, Apple Maps, and industry-specific).



- Optimize and manage Google Business Profiles -- descriptions, categories, photos, weekly posts, Q&A, review response drafts.



- Run monthly technical SEO audits and monitor Google Search Console for all client sites.



- Track keyword rankings weekly, monitor organic traffic, and report on SEO performance monthly.



- Coordinate with our Web Developer for site-level SEO needs and custom page builds.





Requirements: 



- 3+ years SEO experience (Technical, On-Page & Off-Page SEO).



- Experience with professional SEO platforms (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, or similar).



- Keyword research and content strategy.



- On-page SEO implementation in WordPress (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta optimization, internal linking).



- Off-page SEO execution -- link building, outreach, and citation building with real results.



- Google Business Profile optimization and management experience.



- Google Search Console proficiency.



- Content editing skills -- can read AI-generated content, spot quality issues, and edit for natural readability.



- WordPress Expertise.



- Excellent written & spoken English.





Nice to have: Local SEO specialization, schema markup (JSON-LD) knowledge, HARO/digital PR experience, experience with service-based businesses, US local market understanding, technical SEO audit experience.





Tools You'll Use (All Provided):



- Search Atlas



- RankMathSEO Pro



- Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4, Google Business Profile



-Scaliency AI Content Tools Premium Subscriptions (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT)



-WordPress



-Swydo (SEO Reporting)





What Working With Us Looks Like:



- Fully remote -- work from anywhere.



- Full-time, Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week.



- Minimum 4 hours overlap with 9am-5pm MST (Arizona time).



- Communication via Slack, Clickup and/or 
 / Whatsapp.



- Weekly video check-ins + ad-hoc video / audio calls as needed.



- Long-term position -- we invest in training and want you to grow with us.

title: WordPress Web Developer & Designer
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, coaches, retail shops, and other service businesses across the US. We're growing quickly and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's primary website builder and designer. You'll redesign outdated client websites into modern, conversion-focused sites (about 60% of projects), build brand-new WordPress websites from scratch (about 40%), create landing pages for ad campaigns, and maintain all client websites. Everything you build is what clients and prospects see first -- so it needs to be polished, mobile-responsive, and built to convert visitors into leads.





Responsibilities:



- Build and redesign WordPress websites using Elementor Pro -- from template selection to final QA and launch.



- Generate page content using our AI tools (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT), then edit everything for natural readability and brand voice.



- Implement conversion elements across all sites -- forms, pop-ups, CTAs, click-to-call, chat widgets, booking calendars.



- Build dedicated landing pages for PPC campaigns.



- Create reusable Elementor page templates for our SEO Specialist to publish ongoing content.



- Configure on-page SEO technicals on builds (RankMath, heading hierarchy, alt text, clean URLs).



- Maintain all client WordPress sites -- plugin updates, speed optimization, security, content updates.



- Embed external forms and widgets (GoHighLevel, Gravity Forms, other CRM forms, review widgets, calendars).



- Coordinate with our SEO Specialist and Tracking Specialist to ensure sites support the full marketing system.





Requirements:



- 3+ years WordPress development with Elementor / Elementor Pro.



- Strong visual design sense -- your sites look custom and polished.



- Experience redesigning existing websites (template swaps, rebrands, page restructuring).



- Experience building WordPress websites from scratch.



- High-conversion page design understanding (CTA placement, mobile-first layout, user flow).



- Mobile-responsive design across all devices.



- Excellent written & spoken English



- Page speed optimization (image compression, lazy loading, efficient Elementor usage).

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
Remote Operations & Inbox Assistant (Part-Time, Long-Term)

Company: The Body Optimized (
)

Location: Remote – must have 3–4 hours overlap with US Pacific time (Mon–Fri)

Mission

Free the founder (Zac) from admin, inbox, and logistics so he can focus on coaching, content, and product. You are the person who keeps communication, scheduling, and small ops decisions moving without drama, guesswork, or missed details.

If you love clear rules, organized systems, and making a busy operator’s life easier, this is for you.

Compensation & Hours

Rate: Competitive, based on experience and location

Hours: 10–25 hours/week to start, with potential to increase as the role expands

Schedule: You choose a consistent 3–4 hour window within 9am–5pm Pacific, Monday–Friday

Growth path: Start with Phase 1 (inbox + calendar). As you master it, we’ll expand into more operations and potentially increase hours and rate.

When you apply, include your desired hourly rate in USD and target weekly hours.

About This Role

This position was previously held by someone who helped the business through its early, more informal stage but preferred more autonomy as we shifted to systems?driven growth. We’re now looking for someone who thrives in structure, SOPs, and checklists and wants to be in this type of role for years, not months.

Outcomes (What You’re Measured On)

Inbox zero in the main business inbox every workday, with correct tagging and escalation.

Clean, reliable calendar that protects deep work and client time.

SOP execution: You read, follow, and improve written processes without needing things repeated.

On?time logistics: Travel, calls, and events are booked and confirmed without last?minute surprises.

Responsibilities

Phase 1 (First 30 Days): Inbox & Calendar

Own the main inbox:

Triage, reply, or route
s using clear rules (Urgent, To Respond, Waiting On, Financial, etc.).

Apply the 72?hour “urgent” rule (anything affecting money, clients, or reputation in the next and previous 72 hours).

Summarize
s and provide next action

Draft and send replies from templates and SOPs.

Escalate urgent items in chat using a simple template:

Who it’s from, when it matters, summary, what happens if we ignore it, what decision you need from Zac, and your recommendation.

Manage Zac’s calendar within constraints:

Protect focus blocks and client blocks.

Book/reschedule calls with correct Zoom links and time zones.

Add buffers and color coding per SOP.

Phase 2 (After ~30–60 Days): Ops & Logistics

Book and manage travel (flights, hotels, cars) inside written price and airline rules (“Keep It 100,” notify on bigger changes, etc.).

Coordinate logistics for in?person seminars (printing manuals/waivers, scanning, shipping small items).

Light phone work: confirming or rescheduling appointments using scripts.

Load/schedule
s and simple content (Mailerlite, social schedulers) from a pre?built content calendar and copy provided by the team.

Phase 3 (Optional, After Mastery): Light Lead Management

Monitor high?intent inquiries and forms.

Use a simple decision tree to route people to the right next step (coach call, waitlist, free resource) with scripted replies.

You do not create offers or pricing; you execute the existing playbook.

Trial Period (First 30 Days)

This starts as a paid 30?day trial focused on Phase 1 (inbox + calendar).

To continue past 30 days, you must consistently:

Maintain inbox zero on 90%+ of workdays.

Correctly identify and escalate urgent
s using the 72?hour rule at least 90% of the time.

Keep the calendar clean: zero double?bookings, time?zone errors, or broken Zoom links.

Follow all Phase 1 SOPs without needing to be reminded.

If you hit these, we move into Phase 2 and discuss hours / rate at 90 days. If you don’t, we part ways professionally.

Requirements

Excellent written and spoken English.

Strong attention to detail and follow?through.

Comfortable working from detailed SOPs and checklists.

Tech?savvy with
, calendars, Zoom, cloud storage, and basic spreadsheets.

Willing to use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Loom, etc.) as force multipliers.

Stable internet and ability to check in daily during agreed hours.

Available for a consistent 3–4 hour block within 9am–5pm Pacific, Monday–Friday.

Nice to Have (Not Required)

Experience supporting online coaches, creators, or small education businesses.

Prior experience as an EA/VA or operations assistant.

You’ll Thrive Here If…

You love structure and systems (not just tolerate them).

Your first question is, “What’s the SOP?” not “What do you want me to do?”

Feedback feels like coaching, not criticism.

You’d rather have 10 clear rules than vague “figure it out” autonomy.

You’re comfortable saying, “I don’t know yet, but here’s how I’d find out.”

You default to over?communication: flag early, confirm often.

This Is Not For You If…

You prefer loose guidelines over detailed checklists.

You feel micromanaged when work is spot?checked.

You’re “more of a big?picture person” (this role is the details).

You’re juggling 3+ other clients and can’t give this role consistent focus.

You’re looking for a short?term stepping stone, not a multi?year seat.







How to Apply (Read Carefully) - Upwork and PH

Start with this exact line: VA Application – Keep It 100

In the very next line, answer in one sentence:



 According to our SOPs, what should you do if an expense is $100 or less?





Below that, include:

3–5 bullet points of your most relevant experience.

Your typical working hours and time zone.

Your desired hourly rate in USD and target weekly hours.

A short note (5–8 sentences) on why this role fits you long?term.

At the very end of your proposal, include these two sentences exactly:



 I understand this role requires daily inbox zero and spot?checks on my work for the first 90 days. I’m comfortable with both.



Applications that do not follow these steps will not be considered.

title: Marketplace Operations Associate (Overseas – Part-Time)
description:
Remote | 15–25 Hours Per Week

Competitive Hourly Rate (Based on Experience)

Opportunity for Long-Term Extension



oVertone Haircare is seeking a highly detail-oriented Marketplace Operations Associate to support our growing retail and marketplace channels.



This role is execution-focused and responsible for maintaining product accuracy, promotional updates, pricing changes, and operational workflows across major retail and marketplace platforms.

You will play a critical role in ensuring our brand is represented accurately and consistently across all external sales channels.



This is not a general VA role. This is a structured ecommerce operations position with opportunity for long-term growth.

Channels You Will Support

• Walmart Marketplace

• Target Marketplace

• Ulta

• SalonCentric

• Macy’s



Key Responsibilities

Marketplace Catalog Management

• Upload and update product listings

• Update product images and descriptions

• Maintain SKU accuracy and variant mapping

• Ensure pricing consistency across platforms

• Assist with new product setup and launches

• Maintain organized product data documentation

Promotional & Pricing Updates

• Implement promotional pricing and sale events

• Schedule start and end dates for promotions

• Update banners or merchandising assets when required

• QA all promotional changes before and after launch

• Monitor for pricing discrepancies



Order & Inventory Management

• Monitor order flow and flag discrepancies

• Ensure inventory levels are synced properly

• Coordinate updates across Shopify and marketplace platforms

• Assist with troubleshooting order syncing issues

• Maintain accuracy between DTC and marketplace inventory



Ongoing Operations Support

• Follow SOPs for launches and promotions

• Maintain tracking sheets for promo calendars

• Conduct routine audits for listing accuracy

• Provide weekly operational status updates

• Identify inconsistencies and proactively flag issues



Ideal Candidate

•1–3 years experience supporting ecommerce or marketplace operations

• Experience with Walmart, Target Plus, Ulta, Macy’s, or other retail portals is a strong plus

• Familiar with Shopify backend and inventory management

• Comfortable working with product data and spreadsheets

• Extremely detail-oriented (critical)

• Strong written English communication

• Able to overlap 3–4 hours with US time zones



Bonus:

• Experience working inside Mirakl, Seller Central, or retail vendor portals

• Experience managing promotional calendars

• Experience with product feed tools



What Success Looks Like

• Promotions launch accurately and on time

• No pricing inconsistencies across channels

• SKUs and images are consistently accurate

• Order syncing issues are minimized

• Retail portals remain clean and organized



Growth Opportunity

High-performing team members may have the opportunity to:

• Increase hours

• Take ownership of one or more retail channels

• Expand into broader ecommerce operations

• Transition into a long-term operations role



How To Apply

Please include:

1. Your resume

2. Your marketplace experience (which platforms you’ve worked with)

3. Example tasks you’ve handled (promo uploads, catalog updates, etc.)

4. Apps or portals you’ve used

5. Your hourly rate and availability

title: Account Manager (m/w/d)
description:
Du liebst es, mit Zahlen und Menschen zu arbeiten? Dann passt du perfekt zu uns.



Wir suchen jemanden, der nicht nur Kund*innen betreut, sondern wirklich mitdenkt, mitgestaltet und mitzieht. Als Account Manager (m/w/d) übernimmst du bei uns die Verantwortung für spannende Marken und hilfst ihnen dabei, auf Marktplätzen wie Amazon oder eBay das nächste Level zu erreichen. Du behältst KPIs im Blick, entwickelst Strategien, organisierst Projekte – und bist das Gesicht nach außen wie nach innen.



Fühlst du dich angesprochen? Dann bist du hier genau richtig!



Aufgaben

Kundenbetreuung mit Verantwortung: Du bist erste Ansprechperson für einen festen Kundenstamm und kümmerst dich darum, dass alles rundläuft.



Strategieentwicklung: Du überlegst dir, wie wir gemeinsam noch mehr rausholen können – ob Umsatzsteigerung, bessere Sichtbarkeit oder neue Produktideen.



Zahlen lieben: Du analysierst Accounts, ziehst die richtigen Schlüsse aus den Daten und schlägst smarte Optimierungen vor.

Erfolge zeigen: Du bereitest Reportings auf, präsentierst sie verständlich – und feierst die Ergebnisse gern auch mal mit dem Team.



Beziehungen pflegen: Du baust echtes Vertrauen zu deinen Kund*innen auf – langfristig und partnerschaftlich.





Qualifikation

Du hast Erfahrung im Account Management oder einer ähnlichen Rolle – am besten im E-Commerce oder in einer Agentur.



KPIs, ROAS, CTR & Co. schrecken dich nicht, sondern machen dich neugierig.



Du bist kommunikationsstark – ob im Call, per Mail oder in Präsentationen (Deutsch & Englisch).



Du arbeitest strukturiert, denkst lösungsorientiert und packst Dinge gern selbst an.



Du bist kundenorientiert, proaktiv und hast Lust, wirklich etwas zu bewegen.

title: Socia Media Editor
description:
Job Title: High-Retention Social Editor (Freelance) - Guetta Studios 

Location: Remote 



Guetta Studios is looking for a Social Editor who understands that "short-form" does not mean "low effort." We create elite content for global tech giants, and we need an editor who engineers watch time, not just someone who slaps auto-captions onto raw footage. You need a deep understanding of algorithm-friendly pacing, aggressive but tasteful sound design, and the ability to hook an audience in the first 3 seconds without being clickbaity.



What We Require

Mastery of TikTok, Reels, and Shorts pacing. You know exactly when to cut, when to punch in, and when to let a moment breathe.

Elite sound design capabilities; your audio tracks should build tension and drive the narrative.

Impeccable taste in modern, clean typography (no generic, oversized presets).

Seamless integration into our ClickUp and Frame.io ecosystem.

Exceptional English proficiency, high-speed internet, and a professional, zero-ego communication style.

Application Process

Portfolio Audit: Submit your highest-performing, most polished short-form work. If it looks like a generic podcast clip with basic text, we will pass.

The Micro-Trial: If you meet our Gold Standard, you will be given a paid, 24-hour test to edit a 30-60 second social asset from our raw files.

To Apply:

Send your portfolio link (specifically highlighting short-form content), your standard rate, and your time zone.

title: Senior Google Ads Media Buyer – eCommerce
description:
Type of Contract: Independent Contractor

Working Hours: CET Business Hours, Monday to Friday



About the Client:

A specialized advertising agency based in Munich, Germany, focused exclusively on performance marketing for e-commerce brands. They help ambitious online shops scale to 7- or 8-figure revenues in the DACH market (Germany, Austria, Switzerland). Their goal is to grow e-commerce businesses through data-driven Google Ads campaigns while building in-house knowledge and reducing dependency on external partners.



About the Role:

We’re looking for a hands-on Senior Google Ads Media Buyer to join their team. This is not a management role—you’ll execute campaigns yourself, optimize for performance, and create internal training videos (Loom) to explain strategies and processes.



Core Focus:

- Plan, execute, and optimize Google Ads campaigns for multiple e-commerce brands.

- Record Loom videos explaining your strategies, processes, and optimizations.

- Optionally run German-language campaigns with AI assistance and propose solutions for overcoming the language barrier.

- Rapidly test, iterate, and scale campaigns based on results.

- Collaborate with the team to develop playbooks, but execute campaigns hands-on yourself.

- Focus on measurable results and performance over perfection.



You’re a strong fit if you:

- Have solid experience running Google Ads for e-commerce brands.

- Can communicate campaign strategies clearly through video.

- Think like a performance marketer and execute hands-on campaigns.

- Have experience with high-spend accounts or performance-focused teams.

- Are proactive and able to creatively solve challenges like language barriers.



Nice-to-Have:

- Experience running Google Ads in German or other non-native languages.

- Familiarity with e-commerce funnels, promotions, and international campaigns.

- Experience creating internal training resources or documentation.

Kindly fill out this form
