title: Website Designer (WordPress + Go High Level)
description:
Role Overview

JSK Advisory is a fast-growing digital marketing agency and consultancy working with clients across finance, professional services, and ecommerce. We combine sharp strategy with AI-powered systems to deliver results — and we're scaling quickly.



We're looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Website Designer experienced in both Go High Level (GHL) and WordPress

(Elementor preferred). You should have a strong eye for design that converts, a solid grasp of on-page SEO fundamentals, and — most importantly — an entrepreneurial mindset. We don't micromanage. We want someone who takes ownership, solves problems independently, and grows with the business.



In return, you'll get hands-on training in cutting-edge AI tools, AI agents, and the systems reshaping digital marketing. But we're looking for self-starters and fast learners — not people who need hand-holding.



Key Responsibilities

Able to design asethetically pleasing website from scratch in WordPress (Elementor) and Go High Level.

Customise templates or design from following brand guidelines.

Implement basic on-page SEO (meta tags, headers, keyword placement, internal linking).

Ensure websites are mobile-optimised and load quickly.

Set up and integrate forms, calendars, and automations inside GHL.

Conduct quality checks to ensure usability, speed, and SEO readiness.

Use AI to write SEO-optimised service pages to support content marketing efforts using SOPs.



Requirements

Proven experience designing websites in WordPress and Go High Level at another agency (at least 4-5 years+).

Strong sense of design and understanding of UI/UX for conversions.

Proficiency with Elementor (or similar page builders).

Working knowledge of SEO fundamentals (title tags, alt tags, schema basics).

Experience with mobile optimisation, speed performance, and user-friendly layouts.

Understanding of marketing funnels and user journeys.

Strong communication and ability to work to deadlines.

Strong knowledge of branding and webdesign systems.

Familiarity with CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation) best practices.

Experience with schema markup, page speed tools, and analytics.



Preferred Skills

Ability to write clear, engaging SEO articles (preferred but not required)

Comfort managing multiple web and content projects at once.

Ability to use a Miro board to map out funnel designs



Compensation

Hourly rate: USD $6–10/hr depending on experience. Parttime and fulltime available.

Long-term growth opportunities with increasing responsibilities.



Why Join Us

Be part of an up-and-coming agency that is growing quickly.

Get access to and learn the latest AI agent tools so you don't get left behind.

Work Australian hours (only 3 hour timezone difference with the Philippines).



How to Apply

Send me your resume and portfolio of websites. Include a short introduction explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role. You must have at least 4 years experience designing websites in wordpress at another agency. We are looking for someone experienced and proactive, attention to detail oriented and able to take on tasks with minimal instruction. We will provide training on new AI related platforms like AI Agents, but minimal on tasks outlined in the description (we will provide our SOPs but you will be expected to perform).

title: eCommerce Growth Manager
description:
Own Category Growth, Optimize Performance, and Expand Market Dominance.



Hadley Designs is seeking a Growth Manager to take full ownership of a multi-million dollar product category, with Amazon as the primary growth channel. This is a high-impact role for a results-driven e-commerce operator who thrives on ownership, accountability, and driving measurable growth through disciplined execution and data-backed decision-making.



While this role operates deeply within Amazon, we welcome candidates who have driven growth across e-commerce, DTC, or marketplace environments and are excited to apply that experience within a scaled Amazon ecosystem.



How You’ll Win at Hadley Designs:

We believe performance comes from strong systems executed consistently.



Every eCommerce Growth Manager is expected to progress through three stages:



- Learn the Playbook – Understand our category strategy, operating standards, and decision frameworks

title: Personal Executive Assistant 8 fig+ entrepreneur
description:
We're hiring a Personal Executive Assistant for a multi-brand ecom founder based in Dubai.

We DON'T consider you if you send an AI response!



Details: Remote, full-time (100% reliable person)

• $500–$200/month depending on experience 

• A+ player team across multiple brands 

• Work directly with the founder 

• GMT+4 timezone hours (Dubai) 

• Long-term role that grows with the business



I'm an entrepreneur running multiple e-commerce brands. I'm based in Dubai, travel frequently between Europe and the Middle East, and manage several business entities. 



I need one exceptional person to take everything off my plate that isn't high-level strategy or creative direction. If you're the type of person who figures things out before being asked, keep reading.



What you'll do: 

• Book all flights, hotels, and transportation, research the best options, know my preferences, and handle everything from departure times to visa requirements without me having to think about it 

• Manage my calendar across multiple time zones, schedule meetings, block focus time, flag conflicts, and never let anything fall through the cracks 

• Think 3 months ahead at all times, track deadlines, renewals, visa expirations, lease end dates, upcoming trips, and send me weekly briefings so I'm never surprised 

• Conduct research on anything I need, apartment comparisons, wealth management firms, office furniture, service providers, and present the top 2-3 options with a recommendation, not a data dump 

• Manage communications with brokers, accountants, service providers, and legal contacts, draft
s, follow up, keep everything moving 

• Handle admin for a secondary business (small e-commerce site), product updates, supplier coordination, small operational tasks 

• Handle personal logistics, SIM registrations, bank appointments, sourcing purchases, coordinating local services in Dubai • Manage my inbox when needed, flag urgent items, draft responses, archive noise



What I'm looking for: 

• Highly intelligent and resourceful, you figure things out on your own before escalating (if not we won't work with you!) 

• Obsessively punctual and detail-oriented, you triple-check dates, times, and details because mistakes cost real money (if not we won't work with you!) 

• Direct communicator, no fluff, no sugarcoating, you say what needs to be said clearly and immediately (if not we won't work with you!) 

• Proactive and forward-thinking, you anticipate what's needed before being asked

• Exceptional written and spoken English (if not we won't work with you!) 

• 2+ years experience as an EA, PA, or Chief of Staff, ideally for a founder, CEO, or HNW individual (if not we won't work with you!) 

• Expert in Google Workspace, Slack, and project management tools (if not we won't work with you!) 

• Trustworthy and discreet, you'll have access to sensitive business and personal information 



After 30 days, I should never have to: 

• Book my own flights or accommodation 

• Chase anyone for a response 

• Remember a deadline or renewal 

• Research options for a decision, you present them ready for approval



Fill in this form to apply: (don't waste your time filling this in if you don't match the previous criteria)

title: Maintenance Coordinator - Remote
description:
About us:



EIG Property Management is based in Minneapolis, MN, USA. We manage over 1,400 apartment rental units in the Twin Cities. We are seeking a full-time permanent remote Maintenance Coordinator. The role is approximately 40 hours per week, but could be as low as 35 hours in the low season and 45 hours in the high season. The hours are Monday to Friday, approximately 9:30 AM to 6 PM US Central. We are not looking for an agency or someone working another job during our business hours. The candidate should have experience in property management, engineering, or maintenance coordination.



Responsibilities:



- Proactively monitor incoming maintenance requests

- Revise maintenance tickets to conform to standards

- Communicate with residents

- Gather information from residents and tea
mbers

- Assess whether the situation is an emergency or a non-emergency

- Create daily work plans for each maintenance tech

- Regular communication with each member of the maintenance team

- Coordinate vendors (scheduling projects to meet deadlines)

- Call on 50-100 potential new vendors when a new vendor is needed

- Coordinate and monitor the progress of apartment unit turns to be ready for move-in

- Follow-up communication with residents

- Measure maintenance tech performance

- Establish the scope of work for projects

- Obtain estimates and pricing proposals from vendors

- Price shop appliances and other common supplies

- Perform administrative work for maintenance staff

- Communicate with city inspectors

- Review and coordinate city orders and other orders

- Download data and complete data entry or analytical tasks



Job Requirements:



1. Excellent English speaking and writing ability.

2. Intermediate MS Excel or Google Sheets ability.

3. Technology Requirements: strong, consistent internet and electricity, 2 screens, 10-key on your keyboard, headset.

4. As this is a work-from-home setup, you must have a quiet working environment anytime you are clocked in for work.

US Central Time hours as scheduled, generally an 8-9 hour day, Monday to Friday, between 9:30 AM to 6PM US Central.



Qualifications:

- 4-year university degree

- Preferred previous experience in property management and maintenance coordination

- Preferred experience with Google Workspace, particularly with Google Sheets and/or MS Excel,



Application Requirements:



If you are interested in applying, please include the following in your job application submission:



1. A custom audio or video recording. Please take 1 to 4 minutes to share why you are interested in the position, or a quick summary of your experience and qualifications.

2. Confirmation that you are not an agency.



3. Attach a PDF of your current resume with the file name format - FIRST NAME_LAST NAME_Resume.



4. Confirm that you plan to conduct the interview with the same quality of computer and equipment that you would bring to the job, including a webcam, headset, and a strong computer. During the interview, you will need to be on video, and you will need to share your desktop for a brief spreadsheet exercise.



Submit your application by filling out this form:

title: Customer Experience Manager
description:
Department:  Customer Experience

Reports To:  Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Location:  Remote – Philippines (HKT business hours, 9AM–5PM)

Type:  Full-Time Contractor

Compensation:  $1,500–$3,000 USD/month (commensurate with experience)



About SAN Sound

SAN Sound is a Hong Kong-based audio technology company specializing in premium gaming audio products. With nearly two decades of expertise and an expanding global footprint across Asia and beyond, we’re scaling from product-market fit into aggressive growth. Our products—including the Hardwire gaming earbuds and SANWEAR-GT wireless earbuds—are built for gamers who demand exceptional audio quality and comfort. We’re a lean, fast-moving team that punches well above its weight.

The Role

We’re looking for a Customer Experience Manager to take full, end-to-end ownership of customer support at SAN Sound. This is not a ticket-answering role—this is a department-building role. You will be the first dedicated hire in this function and will be responsible for architecting, executing, and scaling our entire customer experience operation from the ground up.

In the early days, you’ll be hands-on—handling all inbound customer inquiries, building AI-powered response systems, creating templates, and establishing the processes and data infrastructure that will allow us to scale. As the business grows, you’ll hire and manage a team beneath you. You’ll work closely with our AI system developers and communications team (copywriting and product tech) to build intelligent, seamless support across
, website, and potentially voice channels.

The right person for this role has built a CS department before, thinks strategically about customer experience as a competitive advantage, and is energized by the challenge of building infrastructure that can handle 10x growth.

Key Responsibilities

Department Strategy & Build-Out

• Own the full customer experience function from day one—strategy, execution, and continuous improvement

• Design and implement the CS department architecture working with our developers: workflows, escalation paths, SLAs, and KPIs

• Develop a scalable support model leveraging AI-first principles with human oversight

• Propose and get approval for builds, tooling, and team expansion from the COO

• Create a roadmap to move from one-person operation to a fully staffed, scalable department

AI-Powered Support Operations

• Collaborate with AI system developers to architect and optimize automated
 responses, website AI chat support, and future AI voice/call support

• Work with the communications team (copywriting and product tech) to ensure AI responses reflect brand voice, product accuracy, and customer empathy

• Build, maintain, and continuously refine response templates and AI training data

• Monitor AI performance and identify gaps where human intervention improves outcomes

Hands-On Customer Support

• Handle all customer inquiries across channels during the initial build phase

• Monitor and respond to customer issues via Zendesk,
, and Shopify

• Ensure timely, high-quality resolutions that reflect SAN Sound’s premium brand standards

• Manage returns, exchanges, warranty claims, and order-related issues

Data, Reporting & Continuous Improvement

• Build and maintain a data tracking and reporting framework for CS operations

• Record, analyze, and report on customer inquiries, resolution times, satisfaction scores, and recurring issues

• Use data insights to drive improvements in AI responses, templates, processes, and product feedback loops

• Provide regular performance reports and strategic recommendations to the COO

Social Media Comment Support

• Monitor and respond to customer queries, comments, and feedback across SAN Sound’s social media channels

• Ensure timely, on-brand responses to product questions, support issues, and general engagement on platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and

• Triage and escalate complex issues from social media to the appropriate internal teams or support channels

• Collaborate with the Social Media Manager to maintain a consistent, helpful brand voice in public-facing interactions

Community Management (Secondary)

• Monitor SAN Sound’s 
 community for customer issues, product feedback, and engagement opportunities

• Provide a consistent, helpful brand presence in community channels

• Escalate community-surfaced issues to the appropriate internal teams

• Note: This responsibility is secondary to core CS operations and assumes AI is handling the heavy lifting on support volume

Requirements

• 4+ years of experience managing customer service end-to-end, with demonstrated experience building out a CS department or function from scratch

• Strong understanding of ecommerce customer experience for DTC brands; gaming or audio industry experience is a significant plus

• Proficiency with Zendesk (required), Shopify, and modern CS tooling

• Comfort working with AI tools and a forward-thinking mindset on AI’s role in customer support—you don’t need to build AI systems, but you need to drive buildouts alongside developers

• Fluent in English (written and verbal)—communication clarity is essential even when leveraging AI

• Experience with ClickUp, Google Workspace (GSuite), and 

• Highly organized, self-motivated, and capable of working autonomously in a remote, distributed team environment

• Strong analytical skills—comfortable building reporting frameworks and using data to drive decisions

• Excellent judgment on when to escalate, when to act independently, and when to propose new initiatives

Nice to Have

• Experience in gaming, esports, or audio/consumer electronics industries

• Experience with AI chatbot implementation or conversational AI platforms

• Background in community management or building brand communities

• Familiarity with international ecommerce operations and cross-border customer support

Why SAN Sound?

• Build from scratch: You’ll own and shape an entire department—not inherit someone else’s system

• AI-forward culture: We embrace AI as a force multiplier, not a threat—you’ll be at the forefront of how support is evolving

• Growth trajectory: We’re scaling aggressively across Asian markets with strong funding and ambitious targets

• Premium brand: Work with products that people genuinely love in a passionate gaming community

• Lean team, real impact: Your work directly shapes the customer experience and the company’s growth

How to Apply

Send your resume along with a cover letter on your experience building CS operations and how you’d approach building an AI-powered support department from scratch. We value clear thinking over long cover letters. Loom videos are a big bonus and will be prioritized.

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*

We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Working Schedule

Benefits

title: Remote Home Health Documentation QA / Chart Review Specialist (Medicare)
description:
Role Summary



Intermed is a Medicare-certified home health agency looking for a detail-oriented Documentation QA Specialist to help us keep charts billing-ready and audit-defensible.



This is not direct patient care. You will review clinical documentation in our EMR (RealTime), identify missing/incorrect items, and communicate “deficiency requests” back to the responsible clinician/admin team using a checklist-based process.



If you have a clinical background (RN/LPN/medical allied health) and you love accuracy, standards, and clean documentation—this role is for you.



?



Key Responsibilities



1) Documentation QA (chart readiness)

 • Review visit notes, SOC/ROC/recert documentation, and related chart elements for completeness and consistency.

 • Use a standardized QA checklist to confirm required elements are present (e.g., vitals, pain, meds, interventions, skilled need).

 • Flag missing, unclear, or inconsistent documentation (e.g., frequency mismatch vs POC, missing required fields, incomplete narrative).



2) Plan of Care and Orders Alignment (coordination)

 • Check that documentation aligns with Plan of Care (485/POC), orders, and frequencies.

 • Identify items that may require MD orders (e.g., frequency changes, new interventions, missed visits requiring documentation).

 • Maintain a simple tracking system for deficiencies and resolution status.



3) Deficiency Communication (no clinical “inventing”)

 • Send concise deficiency requests back to the authoring clinician/admin team (template-based).

 • Escalate complex issues to the DPCS/Owner.

 • Do not add clinical information not provided by the clinician. Your job is to flag and request clarification, not to “write” the patient story yourself.



4) PHI Security & Compliance

 • Handle all PHI with strict confidentiality.

 • Follow security rules: no screenshots, no local saving of PHI, no personal
, no forwarding, no printing.

 • Work only inside approved tools and accounts.



?



What Success Looks Like (KPIs)

 • Turnaround: QA review completed within 24–48 hours of assignment (volume dependent).

 • Accuracy: Flags the right issues without creating unnecessary back-and-forth.

 • Consistency: Uses checklist and templates; clean tracking; predictable follow-up.

 • Integrity: Never “fills in missing info” or guesses.



?



Required Qualifications

 • Strong written English (clear, professional deficiency messages).

 • Proven experience with medical documentation (home health strongly preferred).

 • Comfort working in structured workflows and checklists.

 • Ability to learn and use a web-based EMR (RealTime training provided).

 • Stable internet + secure workspace.



Preferred Qualifications (strongly preferred)

 • Clinical background: RN/LPN/BSN grad / allied health / medical documentation specialist.

 • Home health familiarity: OASIS/POC/frequencies/Medicare documentation expectations.

 • Prior QA/chart review or compliance experience.



?



Schedule & Hours

 • Part-time to start (typical range 10–20 hrs/week, flexible).

 • Must have some PST overlap for questions/escalations (example: 1–2 hours, 2–4 days/week).

 • Work can otherwise be completed on your schedule as long as SLA is met.



?



Compensation

 • Part-time contractor, paid in USD (Wise preferred).

 • No 13th-month pay.

 • Starting rate depends on experience; performance review at 30–90 days with potential increase based on quality and turnaround.



?



Hiring Process (includes a paid work sample)

 1. Short screening interview

 2. Paid work sample (30–45 minutes): review a de-identified chart snippet + checklist and write deficiency messages

 3. Final interview

 4. 2-week paid pilot period (if selected)



?



How to Apply



Reply with:



Subject line: Intermed QA –  – PST Overlap 



Include:

 1. Your clinical/medical background (degree/certifications)

 2. Home health experience (if any) + what EMRs you’ve used

 3. Your PST overlap availability (days/times)

 4. Confirmation you can follow PHI security rules (no screenshots/local saving)

 5. Your preferred hourly rate in USD

 6. Brief answer: If a visit note is missing pain score and respiratory rate, what do you do?

title: Safety Officer 3
description:
The Safety Officer III plays a critical role in ensuring a safe working environment on construction sites by leading the implementation and enforcement of health and safety policies, procedures, and regulations. This position is responsible for supervising site safety personnel, conducting hazard assessments, managing safety documentation, and ensuring compliance with local and international safety standards. The role requires both technical knowledge and leadership skills to foster a strong safety culture across all levels of the project team.

A. Education & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Engineering, Environmental Science, or related field.

Must hold a valid Safety Officer III certification from the relevant national authority (e.g., DOLE in the Philippines).

Additional certifications (e.g., COSH, BOSH, NEBOSH, OSHA 30/OSHA 48, First Aid) are advantageous.

B. Experience

Minimum 5–7 years of experience in construction site safety management.

At least 2 years in a Safety Officer III or supervisory safety role in a large-scale construction or infrastructure project.

Proven experience in incident investigation, safety audits, and regulatory compliance.

title: Vendor Coordinator
description:
Vendor Coordinator



Charlie’s Collectible Show (CCS)

Full-Time | Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST



About Charlie’s Collectible Show

Charlie’s Collectible Show (CCS) is a pop culture and collectibles event company based in Atlanta and Houston, with Raleigh opening soon. We host anime markets, TCG conventions, retro gaming expos, artist alleys, and competitive tournaments bringing together collectors, vendors, artists, and fans of anime, gaming, and collectibles. CCS is built on community. We create spaces where fandom connects in real life.



Position Summary

The Vendor Coordinator manages vendor registration, payment tracking, communication, and event readiness across all CCS events.



This role ensures:

 • Vendors are approved correctly

 • Payments are collected on time

 • Events are not overbooked

 •  Vendors receive clear and timely communication



This is an operations role that directly impacts revenue, vendor experience, and event quality.

We are looking for someone who is organized, confident, detail-focused, and comfortable enforcing deadlines and policies when needed.



Core Responsibilities

 •  Oversee vendor registration and approvals

 •  Monitor event capacity to prevent overbooking

 •  Track vendor payments and manage invoices

 •  Maintain accurate vendor records in Notion

 •  Communicate clearly and professionally with vendors

 •  Manage vendor-related inboxes and respond on time

 •  Send event-week instructions and confirmations

 •  Support vendor map planning and table placement

 •  Keep vendor data organized and updated

 •  Help improve vendor processes and documentation



Key Traits We’re Looking For

1. Detail-Oriented

 •  You catch small mistakes before they become bigger problems.

2. Organized & Structured

 •  You can manage multiple events at the same time without losing track.

3. Comfortable with Systems

 •  You are confident using Notion to track vendor status and workflows. Experience with Square or invoicing systems is preferred.

4. Clear Communicator

 •  You write professionally and respond to vendors with clarity and confidence.

5. Punctual & Deadline-Driven

 •  You respect timelines and understand that delays affect the entire team. You complete tasks on schedule and follow through without constant reminders.

Team Player

 •  You work well with others and believe in building a stronger team together. You communicate openly, support your teammates, and contribute to improving systems so everyone can grow and operate at a higher level.



Qualifications

 •  2–5 years of experience in administrative or operations roles that require high accuracy and attention to detail (examples: law office administration, accounts receivable, billing coordination, invoicing roles)

 •  Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines

 •  Experience using project management tools (Notion preferred)

 •  Experience with invoicing platforms (Square preferred)

 •  Clear, professional written communication skills

 •  Comfortable working in a fast-paced, multi-event environment where timelines matter



Why Join CCS?



At CCS, you’re not just managing vendors. You’re supporting a growing community of collectors, artists, and small business owners.



Your work directly impacts how vendors experience our events and how smoothly each event runs. If you care about building something meaningful and helping small businesses grow, this role gives you real impact inside a fast-growing marketplace.

This is a high-impact role within a team that values structure, growth, ownership, and collaboration. We believe strong systems build strong community, and every team member plays a part in that.

title: Inside Sales Executive – Oil & Gas Equipment
description:

You are the bridge between procurement and suppliers.

Maintain vendor database and develop new vendor sources

Track multiple quotations simultaneously

Ensure pricing accuracy and margin targets

Follow up aggressively but professionally

Maintain organized documentation and CRM updates



Ideal Candidate Profile

Experience in oil & gas, industrial equipment, or trading companies

Strong commercial understanding

Excellent
 communication skills

Performance Metrics

RFQ response time

Quote turnaround speed

Margin achieved

Follow-up consistency

Quote-to-order conversion rate

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
We are Shine Property Services, a growing exterior cleaning and home service company based in Canada.



We hire field technicians and sales representatives across multiple cities and are expanding quickly. We are looking for a dedicated Recruiting Coordinator to help us consistently find and schedule strong candidates.



This is a long-term remote position with stable hours and growth opportunity.



Role Overview

Your main responsibility is to manage incoming job applicants and schedule interviews.



You will contact applicants, screen them, request intro videos, and book interviews on our calendar. You are not responsible for interviewing or hiring decisions.



Your goal is to keep our interview calendar full with qualified candidates.



Daily Responsibilities

Contact all new applicants (Indeed and
)

Send screening questions and video request

Follow up non-responsive applicants

Schedule interviews on calendar

Send interview confirmations and reminders

Track applicants in pipeline sheet

Reschedule no-shows

Keep recruiting organized and moving daily



Requirements

Excellent written English

Comfortable messaging candidates

Organized and detail-oriented

Reliable daily follow-through

Comfortable using Google Sheets

Comfortable scheduling on calendar

Recruitment or HR experience is a plus

Home service recruiting experience is a bonus



Ideal Candidate

You follow up consistently

You keep tasks organized

You communicate clearly

You take ownership of responsibilities

You enjoy structured processes

You are comfortable interacting with candidates



Hours

Part-time: 2–4 hours per day (Monday–Friday)

Flexible schedule, but must overlap with Canada daytime



Pay

$6–$9 USD per hour depending on experience

Performance increases over time



Growth Opportunity

As we grow, this role can expand into:

Full-time recruiting

HR coordination

Team operations support



We prefer long-term team members.



How to Apply

Please send:

 1. A short introduction about your experience

 2. Any recruiting or scheduling experience

 3. A 1-minute video introducing yourself

 4. Your availability (hours per day)



Applications without video will not be considered.



Important

This role requires daily consistency and follow-through.

If you enjoy structured work and clear processes, you will succeed here.

title: Amazon FBA Online Arbitrage Product Researcher
description:
We’re a growing Amazon FBA business focused on Online Arbitrage (OA) and we’re hiring a skilled Product Research VA to find profitable, low-risk products we can source online and resell on Amazon consistently.



???? Your Role:

• Source profitable OA products from retailers (Walmart, Target, Home Depot, etc.)

• Analyze products using Keepa, SellerAmp, Tactical Arbitrage, etc.

• Accurately calculate ROI, profit, fees, and sales velocity

• Identify IP risks, hazmat issues, and gating restrictions

• Log qualified leads into our Google Sheets tracker

• Meet daily sourcing targets independently



? Requirements:

• Minimum 1+ years hands-on Amazon FBA OA sourcing experience (not general VA work)

• Strong ability to read Keepa charts & BSR trends

• Confident calculating ROI & margins

• Experience with Tactical Arbitrage (preferred)

• Familiar with Seller Central basics

• Strong written English & reliable communication



???? Tools:

Keepa, SellerAmp & Google Sheets



???? Setup:

Remote (Part-time or Full-time). Must have reliable internet and ability to overlap with our timezone.





???? To Apply:

Start your proposal with: “I read the full job post”

Include:

• Your OA experience

• Tools you’ve used

• 2–3 sample leads (product name, source price, Amazon price, BSR, estimated ROI)



We’re looking for someone serious, consistent, and detail-oriented. If that’s you, apply now.
